The staff here are super friendly and the food is great! This place is very family friendly and my kids really enjoyed the experience

We made reservations for our party of 7 but weren't informed their tables cannot accommodate us until we arrived. We were led to a bank section and offered a table with a cage theme but had to commit to spending $380. After we were seated we were given an iPad to order. Though once the items are selected, the summary page (checkout) isn't translated into English so we needed the staff to assist us to ensure we were ordering the right items and appropriate quantities. The food, was nicely plated but not very memorable. The seafood fried rice was too fishy for my taste. The duck was served in a tiered platter, it was very pretty. My favorite dish was the Kung pao chicken. I don't think I would return, given the challenges in seating and ordering.
Great food and service! My favorite was definitely the Peking duck and the eggplant. I would also recommend you get the soup with the duck bone left over!

JUQI offers an outstanding taste of Beijing with dishes that balance tradition and creativity. The roast duck is exceptionalâ€”crispy skin, tender meat, and rich flavorâ€”served thoughtfully with your choice of a light duck-bone soup or salt and pepper for crunchier bites. The fire black rice is another highlight, smoky and aromatic with perfect texture. Combined with JUQIâ€™s lively yet refined atmosphere, itâ€™s an excellent spot for an authentic and memorable Beijing meal.

I was always intrigued by this restaurant whenever I visited Tangram and pass by so I finally decided to give them a try.

Food:
We ordered a lot of dishes as it is for a family gathering. Essentially all of the dishes were amazingly prepared and well suited for our taste. Surprisingly, even though the Peking Duck is what this restaurant was known for, the highlight for us was actually the lamb ribs, it was incredibly tender and juicy with a nice light crispy shell and fragrant spicy kick. The sweet and sour squirrel fish was a close second - it was tangy and very appetizing. The beef with crispy mushrooms is a good runner-up. The mushroom was crunchy and fragrant, almost like a potato chip. The only disappointing dish was the leftover duck rack they fried with salt and pepper. Looks unappetizing and taste overly oily. Make it into a soup if you really want to make the best of your duck.

Service:
Service was mediocre, the servers were friendly but were hoping they are a bit more attentive. Dishes also came at weird intervals too. At one point there was a 20-25 minute gap with no new dishes coming in. Our only vegetable dish came in as one of the very last dish (mind you we ordered over 15).

Atmosphere:
The surrounding makes me feel like I am back to China. I absolutely love the decor. We booked a private room and it was modern and sophisticated.

Price:
After tax and 18% tips, we average about $95 per person. Mind you we ordered essentially most of their expensive signature dishes (except king crab) so the price is more reasonable than it seems.

TLDR:
Food was great, especially the lamb ribs, sweet and sour squirrel fish and beef with crispy mushrooms. Service was mediocre, the servers could be more attentive and dishes can come out in a more timely interval. Atmosphere is beautiful a it is like I stepped into a high end traditional restaurant in Beijing. The price is reasonable though can be a bit pricey depending on what you will be ordering.

I honestly would skip the duck the next time I will be back. I find their smaller dishes way more appealing and flavorful.

Atmosphere, service and food are great. I went to the Beijing location and this location in Flushing is just as good! Food came out fast and delicious. Waiters were attentive and kind. This is the best place in nyc to get authentic Peking duck.
best plum juice everï¼great service too
service very nice foods good

I have to say that after reading so many favorable reviews, and after traveling all the way to Flushing from central New Jersey, I was disappointed. The Peking Duck was good but not great. It was served somewhere between room temperature and cold, with more fat than I expected between the skin and meat. Our other two dishes (shrimp and eggplant) were quite good although quite sweet, which puzzles me. In China, none of the main dishes we enjoyed were sweet as so many seem to be here in Chinese restaurants at home. The service was at best indifferent, and the atmosphere lacked the charm and authenticity of so many restaurants I've visited in Flushing. The tranquility I would have expected from a restaurant that was sparsely populated in the early afternoon was marred by the incessant clatter of clean dishes and flatware being moved to and from a staging area that was right behind our table. Although we moved to another table, the incessant clatter continued through our meal. All in all perhaps I was a victim of my own expectations but I expected more given the ratings and prices.
Good jelly fish but too sweet. Peking duck skin was chewy and not crispy at all. Sweet sour soup and noodle ok. Okra was good. Dumplings good. Excellent service. Nice atmo. Food wont bring us back
The best place if u wanna try some Beijingâ€™s local food, Iâ€™m guaranteed to have a good time here, cuz Iâ€™m from Beijing. Every dish is wonderful!
good taste good choice.

My kids are obsessed with the Beijing Duck. And service here is exceptional. Definitely come back again.
Good food and service

Good variety of options. The half set duck was decent. The sweet and sour squirrel fish was great. The shrimp balls were interesting. Wasnâ€™t a huge fan of the fried rice. If I go back would do the barbecue lamb and family style zhajiangmian. This restaurant seems best for a party larger than 2

Delicious duck and good service.
Cute bunny dessert for the kids.

If you have carboholics, the first two orders of the Peking duck pancakes are included, $4 for each additional refill after.

We've been here a few times and the food is very unique and amazing. We love their lobster with cheese with spaghetti, their fragrant pancakes, their shrimps in oil sauce, their Peking duck, their beef with orange sauce, were on point. The staff were amazing, å°å· (Yu), å° K, and Amber were very attentive and friendly. Keep up the amazing work!

Iâ€™ve had the best crispy duck here. The decor and atmosphere is very cozy and relaxing. Enjoying your meal is a great experience here not only because of the atmosphere but also because of the staff. They are very helpful, friendly and attentive. We had questions about the menu and our server took his time to help us order.

I highly recommend eating here. The fried eggplant is a must order! Youâ€™re welcome :)

Peking Duck Perfection ğŸ¥‡ğŸ¥‡

Quite likely the best Peking Duck (aka Beijing duck) in town. Few comparisons on this level of quality, flavor, & texture.

This is authentic and NOT roast duck that is sliced to imitate Peking Duck. The preparation & cooking process is lengthy and generally requires an expert chef to master this art.

One bite will make you swoon with delightâ€¦ ğŸ†ğŸ†

The food was absolutely outstanding â€” every dish was full of flavor, it was a perfect dining experience. On top of that, the service was truly exceptional: attentive, friendly. The staff went above and beyond to make sure everything was perfect. Easily one of the best meals Iâ€™ve had, and Iâ€™ll definitely be returning. Highly recommend!

Amazing food and great experience! The lamb chops were crispy and flavorful, the noodles fresh and tasty, and the Peking duck was perfectly roasted. The cute fish-shaped jelly dessert was a fun, refreshing ending. Highly recommend!

Juqi is located downstairs in Tangram. If you think the theming is great, you will love the food. We came as a party of 5 without reservations during lunch on a Sunday and were seated after a few minutes.

Everything we ordered was delicious. The cabbage cold dish was probably the favorite of the table. The duck took a while to be served but it was worth the wait. While the food was delicious, the meal was expensive so be prepared to pay.

Unfortunately we didn't get to try the uncanny little rabbit thing on the dessert menu. I will definitely be back to try it, and get more duck.
Every dish was nice. The whole fish is much better than before. I do like their picking duck. Amazing thing was about the duck bones. They cooked them with hot sauce. Tasty.

Place this on your bucket list- this place is so amazing! There might be lots of restaurants in New York City, but this is definitely one of the must-goes! The food tastes like heaven, and the people here are so kind! Even after we ate, I could almost feel the goodness of the food on the tip of my tongue! This is DEFINITELY a place to visit, and you will feel it once you go here. I recommend to all Chinese-food lovers that they should definitely visit JUQI; you are guaranteed by almost all to go walking out of the entrance feeling tremendously happy. (For those that doubt the food quality, I personally recommend the tofu and the eggplant for starters.)

Traditional Chinese restaurant, offering a variety of dishes. The ambiance really transports you to Beijing with it's decor. The highlight pecking duck was an 8/10, I thought it could be more flavorful and tender but still really good. Favorite dish was the Kong Pao chicken which left my mouth numb but in a good way. Everything was good, definitely recommend it if you're in the area and want authentic Chinese food.

Everything was delicious! ğŸ¦† The roasted duck was crispy and juicy, the sizzling beef was super flavorful, the veggies were fresh and light, and the cold noodles were refreshing. Great food and presentation â€” highly recommend!

We had a hard time deciding what to order because there are so many good options. Shrimp balls and roasted duck were the favorites of the night.

The presentation and service is very good. It's worth noting that the menu apparently is only in Chinese so you may have some difficulties if you cannot read the characters, but nothing the translation app on your phone can't solve.

Very surprised to see an authentic Beijing cuisine restaurant, Juqi, making me feel like Truedining in Beijing. The food is not not only delicious but good looking. It is a must try if you are interested in local Chinese food.

Amazing food and service! We had 8 people so we got one of the private rooms. We ordered about 12 dishes and they all came out relatively fast. Definitely get the Peking duck; they cut the duck in front of you and display it really nicely. The Juqi fried rice is also really cool and represents the coal stoves of the past. 10/10 recommend this place, especially for large parties.

Cool atmosphere, in the Tangram mall, cool design on the inside evoking some traditional Mao-era design and maybe a little older. Check out the cooler at the front with the ducks. Digital menu, and waitlist grows quickly (no reservations on weekends).

Duck was overly crispy, dry, and the toast points with duck and caviar was overkill... caviar had more taste than the duck. The sauce was off, and while the show is interesting (cutting the duck, display, and the flaming fried rice), the food taste disappointed. Go for the show, but don't expect to have great food. The duck bones salted and fried was probably the best part of the meal. For $100, I've had much better, cheaper, Peking duck elsewhere in Flushing and Chinatown.

Service a bit spotty as they were busy.
Awesome experience! Some of the best Chinese food in Flushing, New York. We got the duck with caviar, and Lychee Shrimp balls - highly recommended. Would definitely come back.

Absolutely fantastic experience! This restaurant offers creative and delicious dishes that are full of surprises.

The lionâ€™s head meatball soup served in an old-school enamel mug was both nostalgic and flavorfulâ€”the broth was rich, and the meatball was tender and juicy with fresh vegetables on top. The crispy fried tofu bites were perfectly seasoned, crunchy outside and soft insideâ€”seriously addictive! The bunny-shaped dessert was adorable and detailed, and tasted just as good as it lookedâ€”a perfect treat for both the eyes and the taste buds. The flaming black rice dish was the highlight of the night. The dramatic tableside flame show created a great atmosphere, and the rice was flavorful and packed with ingredients.

The service was warm and attentive, making the whole dining experience even more enjoyable. Highly recommend this place for gatherings with friends or family!

I went here for graduation day dinner and i donâ€™t regret it. This place is definitely a top tier choice if youâ€™re considering to eat outside. The food here is great and as well as the service here. They are all nice and respectful. Would come again â¤ï¸

Good restaurant in Tangram. We enjoyed the food including the Peking Duck. Itâ€™s a bit expensive for what youâ€™re getting, though the taste of many dishes are unique. Service was okay, nothing special. The space of the restaurant is large,â€¦

We really enjoyed our lunch here! We arrived about 20 min before opening on a weekend and added our names to a waitlist. As soon it opened, the hostess called our name and our table was ready.

The food and service was great and we will definitely come back again! The signature Peking duck was incredible and they carve it tableside. Afterwards they ask if we want the duck leftovers to be fried or made into soup. We choose soup and it was perfect, savory, hot and so flavorful. Perfect way to end our meal.
I was such a great experience! I love the food, the best being the Peking duck in which you can wrap into a roll. Really nice food, just perfect for a hungry stomach. Highly Recommend!

The atmosphere was warm and inviting, with stylish decor. The staff were friendly, attentive, and genuinely made me feel welcome. The food was delicious with a person showing you on how to eat the right way with the duck roll.

Amazing, authentic chinese cuisine. Came with my mom, loved the vibrant flavors. Extraordinary variety and unique dishes pulled the whole experience together.

Absolutely loved the Peking duckâ€”perfectly prepared and full of flavor. The restaurant has a lovely atmosphere, and the staff were incredibly friendly and welcoming. I especially appreciated how attentive they were to the presentation and details of each dish. Highly recommend for anyone looking for a quality dining experience.

If you're seeking a culinary journey through Beijing flavors, JUQI is a stylish stop that certainly knows how to present a Peking duck. Crispy skin, tender meat, and expertly paired condiments made it the highlight of our mealâ€”rich, flavorful, and beautifully executed.
As for the rest of the dishes, we found ourselves wanting a bit more. While the presentation was polished and the ingredients fresh, the flavors didnâ€™t quite resonate with us. Itâ€™s clear that JUQI puts effort into offering an extensive menu, but for our tastes, the supporting cast couldn't match the duckâ€™s star performance. The atmosphere is inviting and the service attentive, making it a pleasant spot overall. But if we return, itâ€™ll be with a singular craving in mind: that irresistible Peking duck.

Amazing roast duck and beautiful atmosphere!
Juqi offers one of the best roast ducks Iâ€™ve ever had â€“ crispy skin, juicy meat, and full of flavor. The environment is stylish, clean, and very comfortable. Highly recommend for anyone looking to enjoy authentic and delicious Chinese cuisine!

The food was amazing ğŸ¤© we had a half duck and it was amazing, this is the second time weâ€™ve come here and itâ€™s even better than we remembered. Iâ€™d highly recommend this place to anyone. ğŸ™‚ğŸ™ƒâ¤ï¸

We ordered the half Peking duck, lucky duck bags, and scallion pancake. I really enjoyed the 3 complimentary starters at the beginning. Typically, Peking duck can be really heavy but really enjoyed this since the Peking duck was light and the thin pancake wrapper was the perfect complement which let the duck shine.

Right off the bat, coming into the restaurant there were koi fish in a small pond near the entrance, with the waiter being very polite. We got a private room, which was very quiet with an elevated rolling center (video below). The roast duck was so good we finished it so fast, and with the sauce and sides, it was even better. There was water and tea when we came, which was great because we didnâ€™t have to wait for it. The table also had three small dishes of sides served only around a minute after sitting down. The spicy beef drenched with sauce (which came in about 15 minutes) was unbelievably good, with some green onions sprinkled on top. The sour fish soup had the perfect ratio between soup and fish, making it so good along with the flavor. Circling back to the roast duck (the best thing to get there, in my opinion), if u get a private room, they cut it perfectly right in front of you then serve it. The toppings included spring onion, cucumber, really delicious sauce, etc. The service was also amazing, and the waitress was really nice and helpful. I honestly love this place and would definitely come back.

Peking duck was really good. Does not taste greasy and oily. Love that it comes with pickled radish and carrots and pear on the side with the sauce. Crab balls were crunchy and really good. Beijing noodles was similar to black bean paste with a hint of mala flavor but not spicy. Surprisingly good too. Will come back to try other dishes!
